tool.name: GEMINI @BINARY@
tool.description: the variants in an existing GEMINI database with additional information

param.name: column_name
param.label: Database column name to use for recording annotations
param.help: A column with the name provided here will be added to the variants table of the GEMINI database to store the annotations

tool.command:
## For GEMINI to work correctly, tabixed file must have form [name].[bed|vcf].gz #set $tabixed_file = "tabixed.%s.gz" % $annotate_source.ext bgzip -c '$annotate_source' > '$tabixed_file' && tabix -p '$annotate_source.ext' '$tabixed_file' && cp '$infile' '$outfile' &&
gemini @BINARY@ -f '$tabixed_file' -a $a.a_selector #if $a.a_selector == 'extract': #set $types = [] #set $elements = [] #set $column_names = [] #set $operations = [] #for $action in $a.actions: $types.append(str($action.column_type)) $elements.append(str($action.element_to_extract).strip()) $column_names.append(str($action.column_name).strip()) $operations.append(str($action.operation)) #end for
-t #echo ",".join($types) -e '#echo ",".join($elements)#' -o #echo ",".join($operations) -c '#echo ",".join($column_names)#' #else: -c '${a.column_name}' #end if #if str($annotate_source.ext) == "vcf": $region_only #end if '$outfile'

param.name: annotate_source
param.label: Dataset to use as the annotation source
param.help: The tool can use the information from a BED or VCF dataset to annotate the database variants.

param.name: region_only
param.label: Strict variant-identity matching of database and annotation records (VCF format only)
param.help: The default is to consider VCF-formatted annotations only if a variant in the GEMINI database and a record in the annotation source describe the exact same nucleotide change at the same position in the genome. You can disable this option to make use of any annotation that overlaps with the position of a database variant. This setting is ignored for annotation sources in BED format, for which matching is always based on overlapping positions only.

param.name: a_selector
param.label: Type of information to add to the database variants
param.option: Binary indicator (1=found, 0=not found) of whether the variant had any match in the annotation source
Count of the number of matches found in the annotation source for the database variant
Specific values extracted from matching records in the annotation source

param.name: element_to_extract
param.label: Elements to extract from the annotation source
param.help: For an annotation source in BED format, specify the number of the column from which the annotations should be read. For a VCF source, name an INFO field element.

param.name: column_type
param.label: What type of data are you trying to extract?
param.help: Your selection will determine the data type used to store the new annotations in the database.

param.name: operation
param.label: If multiple annotations are found for the same variant, store ...
param.help: Note: If indicated (in parentheses) an option is only applicable to annotations of a specific type.
param.option: a comma-separated list of the (text) values
a comma-separated list of non-redundant (text) values
the most frequent of the (numeric) values

tool.help:
**What it does**
Given an existing GEMINI database and an annotation source in BED or VCF format, the annotate tool will, for each variant in the variants table of the database, screen for overlapping regions defined in the annotation source and update one or more new columns of the variant record in the database based on the result and the annotation found.
